verses.verse: Moreover take thou up <WH5375> <WH8798> a lamentation <WH7015> for the princes <WH5387> of Yisra'EL <WH3478>,

And say <WH559> <WH8804>, What is thy mother <WH517>? A lioness <WH3833>: she lay down <WH7257> <WH8804> among lions <WH738>, she nourished <WH7235> <WH8765> her whelps <WH1482> among <WH8432> young lions <WH3715>.

And she brought up <WH5927> <WH8686> one <WH259> of her whelps <WH1482>: it became a young lion <WH3715>, and it learned <WH3925> <WH8799> to catch <WH2963> <WH8800> the prey <WH2964>; it devoured <WH398> <WH8804> men <WH120>.

The nations <WH1471> also heard <WH8085> <WH8799> of him; he was taken <WH8610> <WH8738> in their pit <WH7845>, and they brought <WH935> <WH8686> him with chains <WH2397> unto the land <WH776> of Egypt <WH4714>.

Now when she saw <WH7200> <WH8799> that she had waited <WH3176> <WH8738>, and her hope <WH8615> was lost <WH6> <WH8804>, then she took <WH3947> <WH8799> another <WH259> of her whelps <WH1482>, and made <WH7760> <WH8804> him a young lion <WH3715>.

And he went up and down <WH1980> <WH8691> among <WH8432> the lions <WH738>, he became a young lion <WH3715>, and learned <WH3925> <WH8799> to catch <WH2963> <WH8800> the prey <WH2964>, and devoured <WH398> <WH8804> men <WH120>.

And he knew <WH3045> <WH8799> their desolate palaces <WH490>, and he laid waste <WH2717> <WH8689> their cities <WH5892>; and the land <WH776> was desolate <WH3456> <WH8799>, and the fulness <WH4393> thereof, by the noise <WH6963> of his roaring <WH7581>.

Then the nations <WH1471> set <WH5414> <WH8799> against him on every side <WH5439> from the provinces <WH4082>, and spread <WH6566> <WH8799> their net <WH7568> over him: he was taken <WH8610> <WH8738> in their pit <WH7845>.

And they put <WH5414> <WH8799> him in ward <WH5474> in chains <WH2397>, and brought <WH935> <WH8686> him to the king <WH4428> of Babylon <WH894>: they brought <WH935> <WH8686> him into holds <WH4685>, that his voice <WH6963> should no more be heard <WH8085> <WH8735> upon the mountains <WH2022> of Yisra'EL <WH3478>.

Thy mother <WH517> is like a vine <WH1612> in thy blood <WH1818> <WH8676> <WH1818>, planted <WH8362> <WH8803> by the waters <WH4325>: she was fruitful <WH6509> <WH8802> and full of branches <WH6058> by reason of many <WH7227> waters <WH4325>.

And she had strong <WH5797> rods <WH4294> for the sceptres <WH7626> of them that bare rule <WH4910> <WH8802>, and her stature <WH6967> was exalted <WH1361> <WH8799> among the thick branches <WH5688>, and she appeared <WH7200> <WH8735> in her height <WH1363> with the multitude <WH7230> of her branches <WH1808>.

But she was plucked up <WH5428> <WH8714> in fury <WH2534>, she was cast down <WH7993> <WH8717> to the ground <WH776>, and the east <WH6921> wind <WH7307> dried up <WH3001> <WH8689> her fruit <WH6529>: her strong <WH5797> rods <WH4294> were broken <WH6561> <WH8694> and withered <WH3001> <WH8804>; the fire <WH784> consumed <WH398> <WH8804> them.
And now she is planted <WH8362> <WH8803> in the wilderness <WH4057>, in a dry <WH6723> and thirsty <WH6772> ground <WH776>.

And fire <WH784> is gone out <WH3318> <WH8799> of a rod <WH4294> of her branches <WH905>, which hath devoured <WH398> <WH8804> her fruit <WH6529>, so that she hath no strong <WH5797> rod <WH4294> to be a sceptre <WH7626> to rule <WH4910> <WH8800>. This is a lamentation <WH7015>, and shall be for a lamentation <WH7015>.
